description.p: Your magic springs from a mind altered by alien influence, warping your spells and your very flesh.
When you choose this subclass at 3rd level, you gain the following features.

When you reach a Sorcerer level specified in the Psionic Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared, and they count as Sorcerer spells for you. These spells do not count against the number of spells you can prepare each day.

tr.td: Arms of Hadar, Calm Emotions, Detect Thoughts, Dissonant Whispers, Mind Silver

description.p: You can form a telepathic connection between your mind and the mind of another. As a Bonus Action, choose one creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself. You and the chosen creature can communicate telepathically with each other while the two of you are within a number of miles of each other equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1 mile). To understand each other, you each must mentally use a language the other knows.
The telepathic connection lasts for a number of minutes equal to your Sorcerer level. It ends early if you use this ability to form a connection with a different creature.

sheet.description: Choose a creature within 30 ft from you. For {{level:sorcerer}} minutes you can telepatically communicate with that creature, until it stays in {{telepathic:distance}} miles; shared language required.

description.p: When you cast a spell gained from your Psionic Spells feature of level 1 or higher, you can cast it by expending a spell slot as normal or by spending a number of Sorcery Points equal to the spellâ€™s level. If you cast the spell using Sorcery Points, the spell requires no Verbal or Somatic components, and it requires no Material components unless they are consumed by the spell or have a cost in gp.

sheet.description: Psionic Spells can be cast with Sorcery Points equal to spell level; if so, no V, S, and no M components unless consumed or costly.

description.p: You have Resistance to Psychic damage, and you have Advantage on saving throws to avoid or end the Charmed or Frightened condition.

sheet.description: You have Advantage on saves vs Charmed and Frightened.

description.p: As a Bonus Action, you can spend 1 Sorcery Point or more to magically alter your body for 10 minutes. For each Sorcery Point you spend, choose one of the following benefits; you can choose the same benefit multiple times. The effects last until the alteration ends.

ul.li: Aberrant Movement. Your Speed increases by 10 feet, and you can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.
Amphibious Form. You gain a Swim Speed equal to twice your Speed, and you can breathe underwater.
Ocular Mastery. You gain Darkvision with a range of 120 feet, and you can see Invisible creatures and objects within that range.

Tentacular Limbs. A number of tentacles sprout from your body. As a Bonus Action, you can make one melee spell attack with a reach of 10 feet that deals Force damage equal to 1d10 + your Charisma modifier.

description.p: You can unleash a space-warping anomaly. As a Magic action, you teleport to an unoccupied space you can see within 120 feet of yourself. Immediately after you disappear, each creature within 30 feet of the space you left must make a Strength saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, a creature takes 3d10 Force damage and is pulled straight toward the space you left, ending in an unoccupied space as close to your former space as possible. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage only.
Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a Long Rest or you expend 5 Sorcery Points to use it again.
